doc.field:
This table contains information about the Transit Link Dial-a-Ride Service Areas in the Twin Cities Metro Area. Transit Link is the Metropolitan Council sponsored small bus dial-a-ride service for the general public, where regular route transit service is not available. (ADA service is provided by Metro Mobility, see table ADAService.dbf.)
Transit Link service was implemented in 2010, replacing a system of community based Dial-a-Ride programs.
This table can be joined to the "Counties and Cities & Townships, Twin Cities Metropolitan Area" spatial dataset using the COCTU_CODE field (concatenation of 3-digit FIPS county code and 5-digit FIPS place code). This will allow users to create maps and conduct spatial analyses with the data in this table.

(Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott, and Washington Counties)</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar /> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr /> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale /> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc /> </procstep> <procstep><procdesc /><srcused Sync="TRUE">U:\john_harper\transit coverage\data\other_transit_provider_areas</srcused><date Sync="TRUE">20070501</date><time Sync="TRUE">16521300</time></procstep></lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref>COCTU_CODE: 8 digit code that is a concatenation of the 3-digit FIPS county code and 5-digit FIPS place code</indspref> <direct /> <mgmg3obj /> <mgmg3til>One file for entire Twin Cities Metropolitan Area</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres /> <longres /> </geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn /> <mgmg4par /> <otherprj /> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn /> <utm> <utmzone /> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone /> </spcs> <mgmg4coz /> <mgmg4adj /> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres /> <ordres /> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres /> </distbrep> <plandu /> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn /> <ellips /> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum /> <altunits /> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn /> <depthdu /> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>COCTU_CODE: 8-digit code that uniquely defines every city or township within each county. This is a concatenation of the 3-digit FIPS and MN state standard county code and the 5-digit FIPS 'Place' code (which is also a Census Bureau and MetroGIS standard code for cities, townships and unorganized territories (CTUs)).
COCTU_DESC: City or Township Name
CO_CODE: 3 digit MN state standard county code
CO_NAME: County Name
TransLink: The name of the Transit Link service area. The entire seven county metro area is covered by 5 service areas.</eaover> <eadetcit /> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Mark Kotz</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651.602.1644</cntvoice> <cntfax>651.602.1674</cntfax> <cntemail>mark.kotz@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>TransitLink</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).
